com.github.katjahahn

Class ByteArrayUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.katjahahn.ByteArrayUtil

  • public class ByteArrayUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities to convert from and to byte arrays.

    Supports hex string conversion and long/int conversion. So far little endian only.

    Differences to methods of ByteBuffer:

    bytesToInt(byte[]) and bytesToLong(byte[]) don't care about the proper minimum length of the given byte array: No BufferUnderflowException is thrown. Thus they are more robust.

    byteToHex(byte[]) delimits bytes with spaces and every single byte value is converted including prepended zero bytes in the array.

    getBytesLongValueSafely(byte[], int, int) will also convert arrays that are too short for the offset and the length given. It will assume the missing values to be zero.

    • Method Detail

      • getBytesIntValue

        @Requires(value={"length <= 4","length > 0","bytes != null","bytes.length >= length + offset"})
public static int getBytesIntValue(byte[] bytes,
                            int offset,
                            int length)
        Retrieves the integer value of a subarray of bytes. The values are considered little endian. The subarray is determined by offset and length.

        Presumes the byte array to be not null and the length must be between 1 and 4 inclusive.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the little endian byte array that shall be converted to int
        offset - the index to start reading the integer value from
        length - the number of bytes used to convert to int
        Returns:
        int value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length is larger than 4 or smaller than 1

      • getBytesLongValue

        @Requires(value={"length <= 8","length > 0","bytes != null","bytes.length >= length + offset"})
public static long getBytesLongValue(byte[] bytes,
                              int offset,
                              int length)
        Retrieves the long value of a subarray of bytes.

        The values are considered little endian. The subarray is determined by offset and length.

        Presumes the byte array to be not null and its length should be between 1 and 4 inclusive.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the little endian byte array that shall be converted to long
        offset - the index to start reading the long value from
        length - the number of bytes used to convert to long
        Returns:
        long value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length is larger than 8 or smaller than 1

      • getBytesLongValueSafely

        @Requires(value={"length <= 8","length >= 0","bytes != null"})
public static long getBytesLongValueSafely(byte[] bytes,
                                    int offset,
                                    int length)
        Retrieves the long value of a subarray of bytes.

        The values are considered little endian. The subarray is determined by offset and length. If bytes length is not large enough for given offset and length the values are considered 0.

        This should be used for file format fields, where part of the value has been cut. Example: TinyPE

        Presumes the byte array to be not null and its length should be between 0 and 4 inclusive.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the little endian byte array that shall be converted to long
        offset - the index to start reading the long value from
        length - the number of bytes used to convert to long
        Returns:
        long value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length is larger than 8 or smaller than 0

      • byteToHex

        @Requires(value="array != null")
public static java.lang.String byteToHex(byte[] array)
        Converts a byte array to a hex string.

        Every single byte is shown in the string, also prepended zero bytes. Single bytes are delimited with a space character.

        Parameters:
        array - byte array to convert
        Returns:
        hexadecimal string representation of the byte array

      • bytesToInt

        @Requires(value={"bytes != null","bytes.length <= 4"})
public static int bytesToInt(byte[] bytes)
        Converts a byte array to an int. The bytes are considered unsigned and little endian (first byte is the least significant).
        Parameters:
        bytes - the little endian byte array that shall be converted to int
        Returns:
        int value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if byte array contains more than 4 bytes

      • bytesToLong

        @Requires(value={"bytes != null","bytes.length <= 8"})
public static long bytesToLong(byte[] bytes)
        Converts a byte array to a long. The bytes are considered unsigned and little endian (first byte is the least significant).
        Parameters:
        bytes - the little endian byte array that shall be converted to int
        Returns:
        long value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if byte array contains more than 8 bytes
